programme.title: Premier League Stories
programme.desc: In this episode, we look back at Yoshida's journey from Japan to England's top-flight, his role as a leader for club and country, and the cultural bridge he helped build along the way. Now in the final stages of his playing career with LA Galaxy in the USA, we catch up with him as he looks to inspire the next generation, both in Japan and around the world.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: After getting back to winning ways in the league, Arsenal kick-off their UEFA Champions League campaign with a trip to face Ernesto Valverde's Athletic Bilbao at San Mames Stadium.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: Eredivisie winners PSV welcome Sebastien Pocognoli's Belgian champions Union Saint-Gilloise to Philips Stadion.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: Real Madrid begin their pursuit of a 16th Champions League trophy as they host Roberto De Zerbi's Marseille at Santiago Bernabeu Stadium.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: Two-time Champions League winners Juventus look to get their European campaign off to a strong start as they face Niko Kovac's Borussia Dortmund at Allianz Stadium.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: Bruno Lage's Benfica face-off against Azerbaijani champions Qarabag at Estadio da Luz. Can Gurban Gurbanov's Qarabag spring a surprise against the two-time European Cup winners?

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: Cypriot champions Pafos make their UEFA Champions League debut as they travel to face Jose Luis Mendilibar's Olympiacos at Karaiskakis Stadium.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: Czech champions Slavia Prague welcome Kjetil Knutsen's in-form Bodo/Glimt to Fortuna Arena.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: Arne Slot's Liverpool start their hunt for a seventh UEFA Champions League crown as they host Diego Simeone's La Liga giants Athletico Madrid at Anfield.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: Bayern Munich take on Chelsea at Allianz Arena in a repeat of the 2012 UEFA Champions League final, which the Blues won in dramatic fashion.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: Paris Saint-Germain kick-off the defence of their UEFA Champions League crown as they host Ivan Juric's Atalanta at Parc des Princes.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: John Heitinga's new-look Ajax side welcome last year's UEFA Champions League runners-up, Inter, to the Johan Cruyff Arena.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: Danish champions Copenhagen face-off against Bayer Leverkusen at Parken Stadium. Can former Denmark manager Kasper Hjulmand claim his first UCL win in charge of Leverkusen?

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: After their demolition of Rangers in the play-offs, Club Brugge kick-off their league phase campaign by hosting Adi Hutter's Monaco at Jan Breydel Stadium.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: Eddie Howe's Newcastle United host five-time UEFA Champions League winners Barcelona in what promises to be a red-hot atmosphere at St James' Park.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: Kevin De Bruyne makes an emotional return to the Etihad Stadium, as Napoli face a Manchester City side who will be on a high after a big derby day win.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: Dino Toppmoller's Eintracht Frankfurt go head-to-head with in-form Turkish champions Galatasaray at Deutsche Bank Park.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Football
programme.desc: After dumping Celtic out in the play-offs, Kazakhstan's Kairat Almaty travel to face Portuguese champions Sporting CP at Estadio Jose Alvalade.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Magazine
programme.desc: We take a special look at Kevin De Bruyne's return to the Etihad Stadium. Manager Juan Carlos Carcedo and defender David Goldar talk about Pafos' journey to the Champions League.

programme.title: Premier League Review
programme.desc: A look back at the best of the recent action from matchday five of the Premier League, featuring the Merseyside derby, Man United v Chelsea, and Arsenal v Man City.

programme.title: Supertri
programme.desc: Supertri makes an emotional return home to the island of Jersey, where it held its first full event back in 2017.

programme.title: T100 Triathlon World Tour
programme.desc: Highlights from the T100 Triathlon World Tour in Oropesa Del Mar, Spain.

programme.title: Premier League Netbusters
programme.desc: A unique and fast-paced look at all the best action from the Premier League, including Liverpool v Everton, Man United v Chelsea and Arsenal v Man City.

programme.title: Premier League Stories
programme.desc: In this episode, we look back at Yoshida's journey from Japan to England's top-flight, his role as a leader for club and country, and the cultural bridge he helped build along the way. Now in the final stages of his playing career with LA Galaxy in the USA, we catch up with him as he looks to inspire the next generation, both in Japan and around the world.

programme.title: Serie A Football
programme.desc: Cristian Chivu's Inter look to avoid a third straight Serie A defeat, as they host Fabio Grosso's Sassuolo at San Siro. Sassuolo won 1-0 when these sides last met.

programme.title: Serie A Football
programme.desc: Champions Napoli look to continue their perfect start to the Serie A season, as they welcome newly-promoted Pisa to Stadio Diego Armando Maradona.

programme.title: Ally's Social Club
programme.desc: Mikel Arteta talks to Ally McCoist about playing alongside Xavi, Iniesta and Ronaldinho, his relationship with Pep Guardiola and his vision for Arsenal this season.

programme.title: TNT Sports Films
programme.desc: The extraordinary story of how a young David Rocastle's meteoric rise to stardom inspired another legend in the shape of Ian Wright.

programme.title: TNT Sports Films
programme.desc: A film charting Tom Daley's career from his first Olympics in Beijing at 14 years old, through winning gold at Tokyo 2020 and his final Olympic appearance at Paris 2024.
